definition: Qu Yuan (340-278 BC), famous Warring States statesman and poet, author of Sorrow at Parting 離騷|离骚 Lisao in Songs of Chu 楚辭|楚辞
bent/to feel wronged
surname Qu
Hara (Japanese surname)
former/original/primary/raw/level/cause/source
Qu Yuan Memorial Hall in Zigui county 秭歸縣|秭归县[Zi3 gui1 Xian4], Hubei, built in 1982 and a major tourist attraction since then
Qu Yuan memorial temple on the Miluo river 汨羅江|汨罗江 at Yueyang 岳陽市|岳阳市, Hunan

sentences.english: Miluo River famous, mainly because of the relationship between Qu Yuan.
sentences.chinese: 汨羅江的出名，主要是因屈原的關係。

sentences.english: It is said that such fish and shrimp eat won't eat qu yuan's body.
sentences.chinese: 據說這樣魚蝦喫飽了就不會去喫屈原的屍體。

sentences.english: Qu Yuan, see all of this, extreme anger.
sentences.chinese: 屈原看到這一切，極端氣憤。

sentences.english: Qu later drowned himself in a river.
The Poetry-Reciting Pavilion(Xingyinge) is in memory of Qu Yuan, an ancient Chinese Poet.
sentences.chinese: 行吟閣是爲紀念著名古代詩人屈原而建。

sentences.english: Qu Yuan is a historical play written by Guo Moruo.
sentences.chinese: 《屈原》是郭沫若寫的一部歷史劇。

sentences.english: The origin of this summer festival centers around a scholarly government official named Chu Yuan.
sentences.chinese: 這個夏季節日源於古代中國一位博學多聞的官員屈原。

sentences.english: The award is called "Qu Yuan Cup."
Eg:The Dragon Boat Festival is in memory of a Chinese poet, Qu Yuan.
sentences.chinese: 端午節是紀念中國詩人屈原的節日。

sentences.english: The date of birth and death of Qu Yuan is unknown.
Quyuan was a well-known patriotic poet in ancient China. He was born in Zigui County of Yichang.
sentences.chinese: 屈原是中國古代著名的愛國詩人，他生在秭歸縣。

sentences.english: The opera Qu Yuan is the last musical work of Shi Guangnan.
sentences.chinese: 歌劇《屈原》是施光南最後一部音樂作品。

sentences.english: Qu Yuans ideal society could only be realized by a wise king of Chu Kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 屈原的“美政”理想只有依賴楚賢君才能實現。

sentences.english: Chu people of peril and suffering, pain Yuan.
sentences.chinese: 楚國的危亡和百姓的痛苦，屈原痛不欲生。

sentences.english: Why did the fatuous King send him into exile?
sentences.chinese: 昏庸的楚王爲什麼把屈原流放了？

sentences.english: The famous drama Quyuan has a complicated edition pedigree.
sentences.chinese: 名劇《屈原》有較複雜的版本譜系。

definition: On Encountering Sorrow, poem by Qu Yuan 屈原[Qu1 Yuan2] in Songs of Chu 楚辭|楚辞[Chu3 ci2]
Miluo river in Jiangxi and Hunan provinces, flows into Dongting lake
Chu Ci, the Songs of Chu (ancient book of poems, collected during Han but esp. from country of Chu c. 500 BC)
Jia Yi (200-168 BC), Chinese poet and statesman of the Western Han Dynasty
Wu Zixu (-484 BC), powerful politician in Wu/famous as destitute refugee begging in Wu town, cf 吳市吹簫|吴市吹箫
Sima Qian (145-86 BC), Han Dynasty historian, author of Records of the Grand Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4], known as the father of Chinese historiography
King Huai of Chu (reigned 328-299 BC)/later King Huai of Chu (reigned 208-205 BC)
Grand Scribe, the title by which Sima Qian 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1] refers to himself in Records of the Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4]
the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei
famous piece of writing
Records of the Grand Historian, by 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1], first of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3]
Du Fu (712-770), great Tang dynasty poet
Confucius (551-479 BC), Chinese thinker and social philosopher, also known as 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3]
Cao Zhi (192-232), son of Cao Cao 曹操, noted poet and calligrapher
pre-Qin, Chinese history up to the foundation of the Qin imperial dynasty in 221 BC
Zhang Ruoxu (c. 660-720), Tang dynasty poet, author of yuefu poem River on a spring night 春江花月夜
